content:
There have been many thrilling comebacks on Monday Night Football throughout NFL history. Here are some recommended games worth watching for an exciting comeback storyline:

1. The Buffalo Bills vs. Houston Oilers in 1993 wild-card playoff game: The Bills overcame a 32-point deficit to win the game in overtime. 2. The Dallas Cowboys vs. New York Giants on October 23, 2006: The Cowboys fought back from a 12-point deficit in the fourth quarter to win the game with a game-winning touchdown pass from Tony Romo to Jason Witten. 3. The Green Bay Packersvs. Minnesota Vikings on October 5th, 2009– This game featured one of the most incredible comebacks in modern NFL history. Brett Favre led the Vikings to overcome a 21-0 halftime deficit and beat his former team, the Packers, 30-23. 4. Seattle Seahawks vs. Green Bay Packers on September 24, 2012: The Seahawks overcame a 12-point deficit in the fourth quarter, capped off with a controversial Hail Mary touchdown catch to win the game. These are just a few of the many exciting comebacks on Monday Night Football that are worth watching.
